content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a Python function using the `lower()` method to convert all characters in the string to lower case. The `strip()` method removes leading and trailing whitespaces. The `replace()` method replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores. 

```python
def clean_column(col):
    col = col.lower().strip()
    col = col.replace(" ", "_").replace("-", "_")
    return col
```
This function will work for a string input such as "My Column" or "my-column". It would convert it to "my_column". Please note that if you have consecutive spaces, hyphens or leading/trailing spaces then this will still replace them with single underscores. This is because the `replace()` method only replaces non-overlapping occurrences of the old substring.
